Mechanic

Mojave

Transport & Logistics

Other

6-9 Years

Introduction : Brunel has multiple direct hire opportunities for Heavy Equipment Mechanics with our mining client located an hour North of Santa Clarita, California. As an experienced Mechanic, you would service and repair large mining equipment on site and perform lead duties. You would report to the Mobile Maintenance Supervisor. This is a safety sensitive position. These positions will be on a rotating schedule - similar to a Dupont schedule. Description : Mechanics Level 4 - 6 will be responsible for performing scheduled maintenance on all applicable equipment. Perform minor and major maintenance repairs to equipment as needed. Perform major component change outs and rebuilds. Welding and fabrication as needed. Perform preventative maintenance on heavy equipment. Diagnosis heavy equipment failures and issues. Perform lead duties - mentor and other maintenance technicians. Assist Mobile Maintenance Supervisor and crew members in coordinating work and providing updates on work progress. Maintain records of repairs and preventative maintenance. Work with expeditors to ensure parts ordered accurately and timely. Maintain positive communication with maintenance and operations departments. Maintain a clean, orderly and safe work environment at all times. Adhere to all safety and standard operating procedures. Requirements : 5-10+ years minimum experience in diagnosing and maintenance of heavy construction and/or mining equipment. 1 to 3 years team leader experience. Must know and understand hydraulics and electrical theory. Self-motivated, willing to take control of situations and give directions as needed. Be able to perform major component tear downs and failure analysis. Excel at troubleshooting electrical, hydraulic, and engines, assessing failure analysis, and performing major component teardowns. Be a leader and go-getter who is eager to share your knowledge and grow with the company. Must have their own tools and toolbox, up to and including 3/4 drive impact set. Proficiency with maintenance programs (e.g., Manager Plus). The right candidates will be willing and able to work rotating shifts and have no issue with working in inclement weather. Able to climb and lift 50lbs. Able to operate 26000 lb. lube / service truck and have a good understanding of lubrication i.e. greases and oils. Driver's license required. Must be eligible to work in the U.S. for any employer without sponsorship. Offer : Our client offers a competitive and comprehensive compensation and benefits package, which includes the following: $30-$50/hourly based on level of experience 401K with Company Matching PPO & HMO Health Insurance Plans 10 Paid Holidays Vacation Accruals Relocation package negotiable Organisation : Our client is a mining company an hour North of Santa Clarita, California.

Land Advisor Representative 2

Calgary

Planning & Testing

Academic Bachelor

> 10 Years

Job description As Surface Land Analyst you will be working within the Surface Land team you will be supporting the E&PS (Environmental and Property Solutions) team as well as working collaboratively with the area Land Agent. Responsibilities would include requesting and completing agreements for site access, including road use for end of life surface sites. The client presently has operating areas in the provinces of Alberta, Saskatchewan, British Columbia and Ontario as well as operates in the Northwest Territories and North of 60. Strong Surface Freehold land experience is a necessity. This contractor position will report to the Surface Land Manager and you will join a team of other land professionals, supporting the client's Surface Land portfolio. There may be an opportunity for this contract position to develop into a permanent position, based on company need. Specific responsibilities and skills would include: * Prepare and process of all documents required for land access for well-sites, pipelines and remediation/reclamation sites * Ensuring accurate management of the CS Explorer land system to assure data integrity and to comply with obligations * Respond to external partner queries (landowners, third parties, queries from Controllers) * Work closely with the Global partners * Attend E&PS team meetings, as required * Possess a solid understanding of current industry policies and regulations affecting surface rights * Review, thoroughly understand and adhere to all Surface Land and Corporate procedures including business controls, cyber-security and all other corporate policies * Sound business judgment with effective analytical skills and a strong work ethic * Strong communication, organization and team skills and thrive on working in a fast paced dynamic environment * Working or advanced level knowledge of CS Explorer (or other land system), IHS AccuMap, SPIN, Abadata and Microsoft Office suite * Other projects, as assigned Qualifications Academic: * 8 years+ experience as a Surface Land Analyst/administrator with a proven record working in a similar role * Graduation from an accredited Surface Land Program or relevant experience Acquire and obtain access/lease, steward, monetize and/or divest surface and/or subsurface rights to deliver/protect value and mitigate risk across the asset life cycle, and provide advice on best practices and strategic cross-functional opportunities. Develop, negotiate and execute new commercial agreements (e.g., leases and right-of-ways), obtaining all functional alignment, as required. Analyze, manage and steward contracts, as needed (e.g., acreage and risk management, and compliance). Develop, prioritize and recommend commercial concepts/structures for the acquisition and/or monetization of a business opportunity for new and existing assets. Acquire, trade, monetize or divest asset rights to deliver value. Manage and sustain external relationships relevant to own portfolio (e.g., government officials, land owners, service providers and partners). Provide guidance to support development and execution of business strategies/plans. Negotiate and manage claim/dispute mitigation and resolution. Coordinate and/or determine land ownership, evaluate risks, and cure title defects. Manage and coordinate contract personnel (field & in-house). Provide litigation support.

Site Manager

Gold Coast

Communications & Distribution

Academic Bachelor

6-9 Years

Responsibilities: The role of the Site Manager will involve managing works on site and engaging the different stakeholders throughout the project. Plan and manage the site programme. Communicate effectively with different clients to ensure they receive a high quality experience. Lead the site teams to meet project demands and timelines. Report on Health & Safety, quality, cost control and budget. Meet project KPI's. Ensure projects are adhering to construction methodology and adherence to policies, procedures, relevant codes and acts. Manage sub-contractors.

Senior Project Manager

New Orleans

Quality Management

Other

> 10 Years

Brunel has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Project Manager supporting our client who are a leading mining company. This contractor role will be in New Orleans, Louisiana on a rotational basis, accommodations and travel provided. Potential business trips to Indonesia.Responsible for day-to-day leadership, management and direction beginning in the early phases of project definition with project concept, detail design, execution planning, phasing, scheduling, constructability reviews, and continuing support throughout the execution and commissioning phases of the project, with particular emphasis on jobsite health and safety, environmental protection and labor relations of major mining and metallurgical process facilities projects. The scope of this position includes all aspects of project management from early planning stages through field execution and commissioning activities, with hand-off to the site operations team for beneficial operation. Bachelor's or advanced degree in engineering or related field, and minimum fifteen (15) years experience with the practice, systems, processes and terminology of project and construction management OR High School diploma or GED and a minimum twenty (20) years progressive experience in the field, engaged directly in the practice, systems, processes and terminology of project and construction management Knowledge of the principles and practices of project management, engineering, construction and contracting Proven experience in the management of mining, heavy industrial and capital projects with a value exceeding $500 million Work involves frequent travel, international assignments, and relocation to the site of work Proficient in the use of personal computers in a business environment. MS Word, Excel, Outlook, essential Experience with large copper production and related facilities Prior EPCM experience preferred with design office management Heavy industrial construction project management experience Experience with scheduling programs Understanding of Labor requirements and forecasting Experience in setting KPI's and tracking on a day to day basis Predominant experience in field roles in all disciplines Working as a team member (Client, EPCM & Contractors). Here at Brunel, we offer extraordinary earning potential followed by a very competitive benefit package. We provide the tools for success; world-class training and advanced technology to ensure you succeed within Brunel.Large global mining company.

Instrumentation Engineer

Doha

Planning & Testing

Academic Bachelor

> 10 Years

Act as a technical expert for all matters related to Instrumentation & Control systems across assigned projects, ensuring timely provision of efficient and reliable services to solve technical issues in the production plant.Support in efficient and cost-effective delivery of Instrumentation & Control systems services for assigned projects. Participate in costing and preparation of budgets for Instrumentation & Control systems engineering projects for COMPANY.Carry out feasibility studies and comprehensive testing to support financial and technical viability of new Instrumentation & Control systems and provide recommendations as appropriate. Develop specifications of Instrumentation & Control systems associated with new projects.Coordinate Instrumentation & Control systems engineering review and approval of design, equipment and interface with contractors and vendors on COMPANYs requirement.Ensure projects Instrumentation & Control systems engineering activities are executed according to specifications, within budget, with the contract scope of work and meets the time schedules while highlighting any non-conformances to the reporting COMPANY supervisor.Gather and analyze pertinent data and information and prepare recommendations with supporting technical data for the effective development of specifications and equipment data sheets.Lead meetings related to all aspects of Instrumentation & Control systems engineering matters for proper interdisciplinary communications related to the project, working closely with project teams to support achievement of project deliverables.Carryout technical reviews of all areas of work covered under Instrumentation & Control systems engineering projects while evaluating requests and recommending appropriate solutions and proposing changes as necessary within the defined project scope and protocols to facilitate achievement of defined objectives.Sets up and executes assigned engineering activities such as detailed design, verification and studies relevant to any engineering topic associated to discipline, pursuing objectives of sound engineering and design optimization in term of costs, fabrication simplicity and safety.Prepares design specifications for field instruments, PLC/DCS Control systems, Fire & Gas systems, analyzers, Vibration monitoring systems etc.Participate in technical discussions to resolve technical problems. Provide cost effective engineering solutions based on good engineering practices, codes and standards.Prepare orifice sizing calculations, control valve sizing calculations, thermo well wake frequency calculations etc.Detailed engineering works such as preparation of instrument layouts, hook up drawings, loop drawings, wiring diagrams, cable schedule, interface drawings etc.Prepare Instrumentation & Control systems specifications for Package items such as compressors, blowers, pumps, tanks etc.Prepare PLC/DCS functional logic diagrams based on the Control Narrative, Cause & effect etc.Participate in LOPA analysis and HAZOP meetings.Issue Purchase Requisitions and perform technical bid evaluations.Prepares MTOs and BOQs.

Senior Project Manager

Pinjarra

Production & Manufacturing

Academic Bachelor

> 10 Years

Reporting directly to the Major Project Manager, you'll oversee the project from its initial phases, including power studies, installation and tie-ins, guiding it through all stages to completion. You will be responsible for: Managing the installation of an electric start-up boiler, guiding the project from initiation through to completion This role requires someone with end-to-end project management expertise, particularly in power generation projects You'll navigate the project through all relevant gates and work closely with stakeholders to deliver on time and within budget
